instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3032: What is 820-3032? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWGD? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD. When you see ALL_SYS_PWGD, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3032</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A quarter fan spin - not powering on
threads.message:
Hello again,

I got another problem with a Macbook Air (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3032</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A).
I get a short fan spin (for ~1second) every 5 seconds -  <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWGD</SIGNAL> and all S0 rails are pulsing, S5 rails are stable and there is no Voltage on the VCORE rails.
On <CHIP>U2750</CHIP> i get:
Pin 1: pulsing
Pin 2: pulsing
Pin 4: 0V
Pin 5: 3.3V

The board had some corrosion around <CAPACITOR>C7710</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7623</CAPACITOR>.

Has anybody an idea what could cause this porblem?

Best regards

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3032</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A quarter fan spin - not powering on
threads.message: The MBA is also not starting in SMC bypass mode - just short fan spins.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3032</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A quarter fan spin - not powering on
threads.message:
I suppose you mean 3023, not 3032.

If pins 1 & 2 of <CHIP>U2750</CHIP> pulse, then pin 4 MUST pulse too.
If not, change <CHIP>U2750</CHIP>.
Check diode mode to ground on its output.

BTW, pin 2 pulses because VCORE pulses too (not missing).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3032</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A quarter fan spin - not powering on
threads.message:
Thank you for your reply!
I replaced <CHIP>U2750</CHIP> and now I got a fanspin. But <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_AXG_R</SIGNAL> on L7550 is missing. 
On <TRANSISTOR>Q7550</TRANSISTOR> I got:
Pin 1/2: 8.5V
Pin 3: 0V
Pin 4: 0V
Pin 5: 0V
Pin 6/7/8: 0V

No short to ground on this pins.

But I got <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU_PH1</SIGNAL>, so <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> seems to be powered?!

Thank you.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3032</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A quarter fan spin - not powering on
threads.message:
AXG refers to Intel graphics, which doesn't require power until high graphics load is detected.

So VCORE is stable now?
Check for USB activity, if no video present on internal LCD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3032</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A quarter fan spin - not powering on
threads.message:
Okay, good to know - thank you - learned something new again :-)

Yes my Vcore is stable 1.16V now.
I'm getting no USB activity. Already replaced the BIOS chip with a known working one - same result.
I'm getting fanspin with slowly and steady increasing speed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3032</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A quarter fan spin - not powering on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3032</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A quarter fan spin - not powering on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3032</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A quarter fan spin - not powering on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3032</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A quarter fan spin - not powering on
threads.message:
Try heating PCH and CPU with good flux.
May have luck to be an issue caused by accumulated crap between BGA balls.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3032</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A quarter fan spin - not powering on
